reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Rapid WASH response to the new recently IDPs in the north of Syria

description.narrative: SECD is now implementing an emergency response project in Deir saman, Zarzita and Qatoura (TUR-19/3559/RA2/WASH/NGO/13713) which will be finished at 31-3-2020, and also have just closed another project ( TUR-19/3559/SA1/WASH/NGO/12607 ) during this project SECD field staff are tracking the number of new IDPs who are moving to this area and according to our records more than 14395 IDPs moved to both projects areas with expectation to an increase of the IDPs in the next months by more than 12000 IDPs, and this will increase the burden on the host communities which are suffering already from the limitation of the available resources to cover the operational costs of running the water and solid waste systems which is meant the loss of access of the local communities to the basic WASH needs which is important to save their lives Accordingly, SECD is aiming to respond to the needs of the IDPs especially recently IDPs who came from Idleb, Aleppo, Hama governorates and stayed on Badam, Janudiyeh, and Daret Azza subdistricts /Aleppo and Idleb in unfinished buildings random camps and the communities. This project aims to cover the WASH services need of 41982 :( Men:6991, Women: 7244, Boys 13585, Girls: 14162 ) persons (23879 DPs, 18103 hosted people, and 613 returnees, and 241 Persons with disabilities at Idleb and Aleppo governorates, The targeted communities are Ein El-Bayda – Hanbushiyeh - Foz-zuf, Deir saman, Zarzita and Qatura located at Badam, Janudiyeh, and Daret Azza subdistricts. Through this project, SECD is planning to support the targeted communities with the following activities: -Installation of the solar power system to turn the operating system of the water stations of Deir saman 60 HP, Zarzita and Qatoura 85 HP, Hanbushiyeh and Ein El-Bayda 60 HP into a hybrid power system as an environmental-friendly and cost-effective solution, -Distribution of 2500 complementary hygiene kits and 5000 jerry cans. and 2500 consumable hygiene kits (second round) -Provision and installation of 500 garbage bins 0.1m3 size for the small camps. -Construction/ Rehabilitation of 6 sanitation facilities (latrines) in the small camps. -Supporting of Solid waste management (collection and disposal) -Provide fuel and operation cost for solid waste management -Installation of 40 Water tanks of 2m3 size in the unfinished buildings and small camps. -Delivering of water through water trucking for 2259 new IDPs who don’t have access to the water network. -Conducting 7 hygiene promotion campaigns for the new IDPs especially for women and children. -Technical workshops for the local council and water units about cost recovery, technical issues, and solar system maintenance and operation. -Operating of the water station and water system of Deir Samaan, Zarzita, Qatoura, Hanbushiyeh, Ein El-Bayda, and Foz-Zuf, including using the solar system. -Extension of the water network to deliver water to the settlements of the new IDPs -Conducting FGD designed specifically for people with disabilities to address their need to WASH services The intervention is considering the provision of durable and cost-effective solution to reduce the operational costs of the water stations by using the hybrid power system to pump and supply water for household consumption since the solar power system can be applied in the targeted water stations due to its safe locations and the technical specifications of the water stations is suitable for such solution.SECD will perform all these activities as an emergency response which is requiring a dynamic action and giving the priority to the new IDPs in the targeted locations and considering the protracted needs and the good preparedness to respond to any possible increase in the number of the IDPs according to WASH cluster recommendations, the project linked to HPR2020 and related to the OPS project number: HSYR20-WSH-163913-1.

owner-org.narrative: United Nations OCHA Financial Tracking Service (UN OCHA FTS)
